text: Below is a list of covered bridges in Delaware. There are only three authentic covered bridges in the U.S. state of Delaware of which two are historic. A covered bridge is considered authentic not due to its age, but by its construction. An authentic bridge is constructed using trusses rather than other methods such as stringers, a popular choice for non-authentic covered bridges. ==List== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !Name ! class=unsortable |Image ! County ! Location ! Built ! Length ! Crosses ! Ownership ! Truss ! title: List of covered bridges in Delaware
